fields.summary: JIRA REST does not return errors on transitioning an issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33908].
  {panel}

Please excuse project selection, there isn't one for Tools like Nexus.

So, take jira-api, v6.0.4, its published as a pom and a jar with no javadoc.  Strangely, all the earlier snapshot releases *do* have javadoc associated.

This isn't a one off as it can be seen to apply to earlier releases, and isn't localised to jira-api alone, as other libraries have similar problems, eg jira-core.  On the flip-side, there are some libraries that don't show this such as jira-mail-plugin.

Please allocate this as required (or create a 'Developer Tools' type project which is a more natural home to cover 'everything else' that isn't an actual Atlassian product/library?)

Why do I want this? well, apart from being able to get the current docs, I want to integrate javadoc as a build dependency

ta muchly!
fields.summary: Javadoc not published for final JIRA api lib point releases

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33905].
  {panel}

Currently JIRA bundles with JIRA DVCS Connector for Bitbucket and GitHub v. 1.3.1.1

Due to changes that GitHub made recently, this version can no longer access GitHub.  The plugin has been updated with the new changes to access GitHub.

Please upgrade the bundled plugin version with later JIRA releases.  Current latest release that can access GitHub:
* JIRA DVCS Connector for Bitbucket and GitHub v. 1.4.0.1.

side note: UPM no longer checks if system plugins need upgrading, so admins would not know that an upgrade is available
fields.summary: Upgrade DVCS plugin within JIRA

fields.description:
h4. Steps to Reproduce
# Create Project A with Default Field Configuration
# Create Project B with 'Due Date' as a hidden field
# Create 6 Issues in Project A, 3 with Due Dates fields, 3 Without
# Create 3 Issues in Project B
# Go to Issue Navigator and Sort by Due Date

h4. Expected Results
Issues with Empty Due Date field are grouped together, and issues with Due Date values are grouped

h4. Actual results
Issues with Hidden Due Date grouped, Issues with Due Date value are grouped, and Issues with empty Due Date values are grouped

Hidden fields should be treated the same as fields with no values.
fields.summary: Issues with Hidden Field are not Sorting Properly
Documentation update - Viewing a Project's Burndown Chart
Top toolbar drop down arrow shows wrong color in IE 8
Add workflow transition to sum up time spent in status and add to remaining estimate

fields.description:
In our case, the values are Sunday through Saturday. Sunday is sequence value 0 and so on through Saturday which is 6.

However when viewed in the summary, the days will not be displayed in the sequence order but in some other order. 

For example you check Sunday, Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday. The values are displayed as Tuesday, Wednesday, Sunday, Monday. See attached screenshots.
fields.summary: Multi checkbox values displayed out of order on the issue summary page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33898].
  {panel}

Quite similar to what we currently have in the *Attachment* system field but this feature will be more dynamic.

As an example, we already have the "+" icon next to the *Attachments* section.
!feature_1.JPG|thumbnail!

Extracting the feature that we have in *Attach Screenshot* where we are able to specify _File name_ and _Update commet_, can we try to come up with a feature like *Text Enclosure* section where users are allowed to add quick notes (like attachments) on-the-fly specifying the title and the comment? So, when the customer clicks on the "+" sign, a screen will display the "Title" and "Comment" to include in the ticket. The list of *Text Enclosures* will then be displayed, just like how *Attachments* are listed :
!feature_2.JPG|thumbnail!

Listing of "Text Enclosures":
!feature_3.JPG|thumbnail!

This function should also be retrievable via *JQL* and *SQL query* to make it easy for users to come up with reporting or data extraction. Also, this feature should also be implemented globally, not only per project, per screen, per issue type to make it easy to manage.
fields.summary: Text Enclosure in JIRA
2 Instances
As a GH user, I'd like to be able to sort the workflow steps after creation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33894].
  {panel}

Hi,

I apologize for putting this into "JIRA" category, but I couldn't find any suitable category for this issue, so please move this issue where it belongs. Thanks in advance.

I tried to follow this tutorial to set up the atlassian repository on my Ubuntu machine: https://developer.atlassian.com/display/DOCS/Install+the+Atlassian+SDK+on+a+Linux+or+Mac+System#InstalltheAtlassianSDKonaLinuxorMacSystem-Step1:DownloadandInstalltheSDK

After I went to the step which says "apt-get update", the apt updated all the other repositories and got stuck with atlassian, with the message "Waiting for headers".

5 or 10 minutes later (I lost the count), the process finished with these errors:
------------------------------------
Ign http://sdkrepo.atlassian.com stable Release.gpg                            
Ign http://sdkrepo.atlassian.com stable Release
Ign http://sdkrepo.atlassian.com stable/contrib TranslationIndex
Err http://sdkrepo.atlassian.com stable/contrib amd64 Packages
  Undetermined Error
Err http://sdkrepo.atlassian.com stable/contrib i386 Packages
  Undetermined Error
Ign http://sdkrepo.atlassian.com stable/contrib Translation-en_US
Ign http://sdkrepo.atlassian.com stable/contrib Translation-en
Fetched 72 B in 11min 22s (0 B/s)
W: Failed to fetch http://sdkrepo.atlassian.com/debian/dists/stable/contrib/binary-amd64/Packages  Undetermined Error

W: Failed to fetch http://sdkrepo.atlassian.com/debian/dists/stable/contrib/binary-i386/Packages  Undetermined Error

E: Some index files failed to download. They have been ignored, or old ones used instead.
------------------------------------

Can this be fixed please?
P.S. I downloaded deb file manually and will try to install it using dpkg, but it would be nice to fix this error in order for other people to be able to use atlassian sdk without issues.
fields.summary: sdkrepo.atlassian.com says "Waiting for headers" for a couple of minutes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33892].
  {panel}

Dear Support,

Maybe I am misunderstanding some settings in the JIRA admin section but here's what I'd like to be able to do:
- about 50% of our JIRA users are standard "users" and do not have access to log into JIRA directly. They are jsut able to open tickets via email, receive email notifications and comment via email.

As we are also using JIRA as an IT Helpdesk / Ticketing system, we'd like our standard users to receive an email notification when their ticket is created in JIRA. I tried to add the Issue Created - Reporter notification in the notification scheme.

Problem is, users don't receive their "own" notification as I presume the "Do not notify my changes" option in their profile is set by default.

How could we tackle this problem?
I saw we could change this default setting but it will change it for ALL users, including "active" JIRA users that will also receive all those notifications as well as when they comment issues, or change other fields. This will lead to way too many emails.

Do you know a way to set this email notification only for the issue creation to the reporter with the ability to notify the reporter of his own issue?

Thanks for your help and understanding,
Olivier
fields.summary: Email notification when issue is created
Enable to Filter "Solved" linked Issues links

fields.description:
*UPDATE:* This issue has been fixed, but an incorrect fix version was placed on this issue (apologies for any confusion caused). Details on when this fix will ship:
* *Download customers* - this will ship with JIRA 6.1.3, *OR* you can update the [JIRA Workflow Designer Plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-workflow-designer] to 6.1.0.11 (or greater) via "Manage Add-ons" in your instance.
* *OnDemand customers* - the fix for this issue has already shipped. Please comment if you are still experiencing issues.

h3. Summary
Unable to scroll on 'view issue' and 'issue navigator' pages with iOS

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Using an iPad, log in to an OnDemand instance.
# Go to an issue that has quite a few comments on it, such that you can't see all the comments in one page.
# Attempt to scroll down to see the rest of the comments.

You will find that attempting to scroll does nothing.

Note that this is using the desktop interface (the default for iPads) not the mobile interface.

A customer encountered this issue with Safari running on latest iOS version (6.1.3). This also happens in Chrome for iOS.

h3. Workaround

Find a web browser for iPad that has a scrollbar that you can tap. That's how a customer is working on an iPad while the resolution is not implemented.
fields.summary: Unable to scroll on 'view issue' and 'issue navigator' pages with iOS
Pass unsaved JQL data from the "Filter" page to the "Filter Detail" page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33887].
  {panel}

As per this documentation: http://lucene.apache.org/core/3_2_0/api/all/org/apache/lucene/index/IndexWriter.html#deletionPolicy

Lucene does not "out of the box" support NFS, though it could be possible at a very low level to get this to work given the instructions on the IndexWriter page.

Currently as this is not implemented JIRA's Lucene Index directlry running over an NFS mount is not supported:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Supported+Platforms
fields.summary: Implement JIRA Lucene Index NFS Support

fields.description:
It seems that hours and minutes are ignored by {{jira.lf.date.relativize = false}} while the day, such as 'Yesterday' string seems to be working correctly in Created and Updated dates.

I had create an issue yesterday as a test, and the Created date is showing _11/Jul/13 11:57 PM_ instead of _Yesterday 11:57 PM_. Creating a new issue will show "Seconds ago" and then "Minutes ago" instead of _12/Jul/13 5:57 PM_ in the Issue view page.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Configure JIRA 6.0.4
# Configure {{jira.lf.date.relativize = false}} in {{jira-config.properties}} or {{jpm.xml}}
# Start JIRA 6.0.4
# Create new issue and it will show "seconds ago" on Created and Updated dates

h3. Expected behaviour
It should directly show date and time for Created dates after the issue creation

h3. Tested environment
* This issue occurs in JIRA 6.0 and JIRA 6.0.4
* It is showing the expected behaviour in JIRA 5.2.11
fields.summary: Hours and minutes do not respect jira.lf.date.relativize = false

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33875].
  {panel}

To reproduce on a new install, you must have a saved filter:
# Make a search, save it as a new filter
# Modify the columns for the filter
# check print view to confirm it is correct
# Now change your search criteria
# Note that the JQL changes
# check print view, JIRA is now basing the print view on a JQL search instead of a filter

This behavior causes some confusion among users.
fields.summary: Viewing a saved(and then modified) filter in printable mode does not use the saved Filter Columns

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33874].
  {panel}

In JIRA 6.0, when the user search for issues in the issue navigator, and he chooses to have a criteria such as _Resolution_ set to *All*. After saving the filter, the criteria _Resolution_ will disappear.

This is an intended behavior in JIRA 6.0, but it will be nice if users have the ability to choose to have this behavior in their JIRA instance or not. Because for some users, it is not appropriate to have such behavior.

I have screen-cast the behavior on the following link:
* http://screencast.com/t/oc5HxVWHEFo
fields.summary: The ability to disable the filter's selection criteria disappearing in the saved filters

It is possible for the "Add Watcher" dialog on the view issue page to suggest a user that cannot watch the issue. The client will render an error saying the user cannot be added. JIRA should not show users that cannot be added.

fields.description:
Rationale:

While the popover create issue dialog may need to restrict the width of the entry boxes (discussion of this is being tracked: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-28196), there is no need to do this in the full page issue creation screen.

Previous behaviour:

JIRA 5.2.11:

Right click on Create Issue, and open in new tab. The description field fill use the full width of the page.

JIRA 6.x:

Right click on Create Issue, and open in new tab. The description field use a fixed width, ignoring the width of the browser.
fields.summary: Create issue on full page should use full width of page
The 'Components' field should list the full list of available components

fields.description:
h4. Actual behavior:

When you have an issue that has the Security Level set and you link to another issue that does not have it, if you go to the "public" issue and click on the _History_ tab, you are able to see that the issue exists.

h4. Steps to Reproduce:

- Create an issue and set the Security Level so others can view the issue.
- Create another issue without the Security Level.
- On the first issue, create a link to the second one.
- Now click on the history of the second issue. You will see that the link exists.

This issue has the Security Level set and can't be seen by the reporter of the second issue:
!Screen Shot 2013-07-11 at 3.58.11 PM.png!

And in this issue, while the linked issues section is not present, if you click on history you can see the link
!Screen Shot 2013-07-11 at 3.58.26 PM.png!

h4. Expected behavior: 

The issue should not show up in the history for security reasons.

h4. Workaround:

No workaround available.
fields.summary: Issues with Security Level field show up in linked issue history

Similar to JRA-6765, please provide a means within the Admin U/I to set the site-wide default attachment sort order.

We have some JIRA instances which are extremely attachment-heavy, and sorting by date is far easier to work with than sorting by name... 

It would be great if it was configured as easily as [configuring sub-task columns|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/147620/add-column-to-list-of-sub-tasks].

Thanks!

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33850].
  {panel}

*Steps to Reproduce:*

* Create a number of Groups with mixed cases
* Preview the People/Roles section of any project administration
* Attempt to add a group to any Project Role by typing into the Group's field
* The behaviour of the Group browser field can be quite erratic as shown in the attached screenshots. Basically the field will sometimes behave as case-insensitive.

Screenshot:
* case-insensitive behaviour after entering 1 character
!case sensitive behaviour after entering 2 characters.bmp|thumbnail!

* case sensitive behaviour after entering 2 characters
!case-insensitive behaviour after entering 1 character.bmp|thumbnail!


*Notes*
It is good to note that while it is not possible to create a group like 'Jira-users' (it will not be created due to this bug), it can still be created via import. When both 'Jira-users' and 'jira-users' exist on the instance, attempts to remove 'Jira-users' will instead remove 'jira-users'.
fields.summary: Groups Browser on Project Roles Search is Case-sensitive

fields.description:
Most of the REST resources in the Navigator plugin accept "x-www-form-urlencoded" bodies but do not check for an XSRF token when making mutative changes. For example:

* SaveFilterResource: Allow XSRF attack to change user's filter.
* SuppressedTipsResource
* UserSearchModeResource
* PreferredSearchLayoutResource
* IssueTableResource: Allow XSRF attack to change the user's current search.
*...
fields.summary: Some of the REST resources in Navigator plugin are susceptible to XSRF attacks

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33848].
  {panel}

If you create a long JQL you end up creating a long URL (i.e. the URL contains the JQL). This makes the URL useless for a couple of reasons:

# On IE you start getting JS errors once the URL reaches over 4K. 
# On the other browsers you wont get an errors, but the URL will stop be correctly because Tomcat and/or and proxy will stop parsing it and will return a 400.

It would be nice if the issue navigator URL scaled to any size JQL string.
fields.summary: Allow URLs on the issue navigator to work for any size JQL.
Got feedback button has old logo

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a project with any user as the Lead
# Rename the username for the project Lead
# Go to project administration and click Edit Project
# Add some descirption for project
# Click Update

h3. Expected Results
Project is updated

h3. Actual Results
# Nothing happens, no error messages as well.
# Nothing in logs

h3. Workaround
# Change the Project Lead to an user who has not been renamed
# Make the Project Edits
# Revert Project Lead back to original user

Note: it's not possible to determine if an user had been renamed in JIRA's interface, but you can check via the database table *app_user*.  If the *user_key* does not match *lower_user_name*, then the username had been changed.
fields.summary: Project Edit Is Broken If Project Lead Is A Renamed User

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33837].
  {panel}

According to our documentation on [Deleting users|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Managing+Users#ManagingUsers-Deletingauser]:

{quote}
To delete a user:

    Locate the user in the User browser (see Viewing Users above) and click the Delete link in the Operations column.
    The confirmation screen that follows will summarise any involvement of that user in the system by showing current issues assigned to and reported by that user, etc. These connections between the user and other parts of the system may prevent the deletion of that user. 
    Take any actions required to disassociate the user with JIRA. These may include:
        Reassigning any issues assigned to the user.
        Bulk-editing the issues created by the user and change the 'Reporter' to someone else. You'll need the 'Modify Reporter' permission to do this. You will also need to allow editing of closed issues if some of the issues the user created are closed and you do not wish to reopen them.
        Changing the owner of shared dashboards owned by the user. See Managing Shared Dashboards.
        Changing the project lead for any projects that the user is a lead of.
    If there are no issues assigned to, or reported by the user, the confirmation screen will display a Delete button; click this to proceed with the deletion.

Please Note:

    The filters and dashboards of a user will be deleted when the user is deleted, regardless of whether the filters or dashboards are shared with other users.
    Any numbers of issues which have been reported by or assigned to the user you are attempting to delete, are respectively hyperlinked to a list of the individual issues (in the Issue Navigator).
{quote}

However, if a user made comments to issues, it cannot be deleted. JIRA will display the following message:

{quote}
Cannot delete user 'xxx has associations in JIRA that cannot be removed automatically.

Change the following and try again:

* Issue Comments: 10
{quote}

This needs to be included in the documentation.
fields.summary: Edit the documentation on Deleting Users

fields.description:

i put the below java script in to description field configuration, and it works great when opening bug, the description is in bold and the template worked well, somehow after that, user couldn't change status to Resolve, and Jira stuck.

<script language="JavaScript">
if ( document.getElementById("description").value == "" )
     var x = document.getElementById("description")
    x.value = "*+Environment Details:+*

*+Description:+*

*+Steps to reproduce:+*
1.
2.
3.
*+Expected results:+*

*+Actual results:+*

*+Recovery:+*";
</script>
{noformat}
fields.summary: Java script somehow cause Jira to stuck when changing status to Resolve

Regards
Lars

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33829].
  {panel}

There is an odd behavior when a user tries to modify the workflow arrows (in the *Diagram*) mode, and position them to the edge of the status. It seems that when he goes out of the *Diagram* mode to the *Text* mode, and then comes back again to the *Diagram* mode, those arrows' modifications will be reset to the default arrow position.

h4.Steps to produce:
# Go to (_Issues > Workflows_)
# Choose a workflow and edit it in the *Diagram* mode
# Try positioning the arrows to the end of the statuses
# Go to the *Text* mode of the workflow and then go back again to the *Diagram* mode

You will notice that the arrow was back to the default position.

It will be nice, if the arrow remains in the same position, instead of resetting back to the default position.
fields.summary: Workflow arrows' position resets

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33828].
  {panel}

Provide the ability to associate one or more groups or individuals that identify valid users for a custom user field. 
For example, I create a custom field that we want to associate a QA to; however, I only want users who are in the QA group to be able to be selected vs being able to associate any user. 
When setting up the custom field, I can identify which groups and/or individuals that identify the list of valid users for that field. 

This helps control data integrity and ensures the right people are communicated to, without delay, since I can already create a notification for anyone associated with such a field
fields.summary: Ability to associate groups to custom user field
I'll very helpfull to be able to filter "only" projects

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33826].
  {panel}

h4. Steps to Reproduce

1. create an image of size 1316x4298, save as JPG
2. create a new bug in JIRA, upload this image

h4. Expected Results

1. Thumbnail is contained within it's box.

h4. Actual Results

1. Image exceeds the thumbnail border bounds and covers text on the other parts of the page (see attached).
fields.summary: Thumbnails of very tall images do not render on the bug page correctly
Make it easier to distinguish commit comments within the JIRA issue's comment tab

fields.description:
It is possible in OnDemand to link an JIRA issue to a certain page in Confluence by hitting "more actions">"link".
However, if the name of the page contains a colon, which in the URL will be translated to %3A, an error occurs.

*Workaround*
Change the %3A in the URL to the colon character and link them thereafter, but the app should be able to handle this without changing the URL.
fields.summary: Linking an issue with a page does not work if there is a unicode character in the name of the page
Make roadmap exportable as pdf
Exception in Flow Dock Issue Listener triggered by GH detail view update
Option to select schemes (notification, permission, issue type) upon project creation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33819].
  {panel}

Hi,

I'd like to be able to make statistics on a project, about the change history of the issues.

I need to get a list of the change history of a selection of issues (date, status).
I know how to see the change history of an issue, but except with SQL request on the DB, I don't know how to find this information for a selection of issues.

Thks
fields.summary: Find the change history of an issue through the JQL search
Make possible to OnDemand administrators to edit JIRA Advanced Settings
Allow setting a default dashboard per Group
"Importer Actions" plugin should not be listed under "User-installed Plugins" in UPM
Misleading error message when attempting to import corrupted attachments zip
Allow administrator to configure date-time display format

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33812].
  {panel}

Hi,

we build an external user managment. With the API we can set new users, assign groups, etc. BUT it is not possible to set the Access-Level for a user. So all the time a manual action must happen to finalize the creation of a new user.

Please add a setAccessLevel() - function to the API.

http://docs.atlassian.com/rpc-jira-plugin/latest/com/atlassian/jira/rpc/soap/JiraSoapService.html

Thank you!

Fabian
fields.summary: Set Access Level with API
Log work 'Set to field' auto-selected the associated radio button
Create new repository in Bitbucket when a project is created in JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33809].
  {panel}

It would be useful to create an association of sub-task types with a given parent-task type.

I've create a risk register system, whereby I have an issue type of "Risk" and a sub-task of associated treatments of types "Treatment"

I would like to be able to associate the "Treatment" type with "Risk" so only sub-type issues of that type can be create to "Treatment", but "Sub-task" can still be made for existing issues.

This would prevent the user from having to make a decision about which type of issue should be created.
fields.summary: Sub-task type association with parent-task type
Workflow post-function request for "Transition all sub-tasks"
Mass migration of projects to different workflow schemes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33806].
  {panel}

We've created an issue custom field called "Departments" by which many of our dashboard gadgets are sorted on.  If the field is left empty at issue creation or update, the Pie Chart will show a "None" portion which is perfect.  But if we want to see the details of the issues left blank on the custom field, the related filter shows an empty issue list.  It seems like the "EMPTY" key word is not working properly in the query.  Here is the query example:

filter = HKN_ALL_Unresolved_Not_Waiting_Approval AND project = HKNFAT AND "HKN Department" is EMPTY

In this example, the Pie Chart shows 2 issues with "none" as HKN Department, but the query returns 0 issues.

Please help.
Thank you.
fields.summary: Pie Chart gadget data does not show in related filter

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33805].
  {panel}

* We need to be able to allow our customers to email support requests into our Jira install.
* We cannot create users automatically when someone not already set up in Jira emails a support request in. I understand that in that case, we have to set up a dummy account, and set the "reporterusername" to that dummy account, so that the dummy account can create the ticket on behalf of the customer who mailed in the support request.

Now, here is our problem. In this scenario, the customer, the person who sent in the email requesting support, never gets a confirmation email from the system that their request was received. They never get automatic emails from Jira informing them of comments or progress to their request, and they never get an automatic email from Jira telling them when their request is completed or closed.

I see that the original customer's email address is appended to the issue description field, and that our customer support personel can copy that address and manually create email updates to keep the customer informed, but for us, that creates additional workflow issues and potential for omissions that are not acceptable to us. Is there any way to have Jira email the customer who sent in the ticket automatically when the ticket is created, updated and closed, given our environment?
fields.summary: Change how the reporterusername parameter behaves on issue creation via email

fields.description:
The documentation states:

_You can only specify time estimates and log work on an issue if your JIRA administrator has granted you the Work On Issues permission in the project to which the issue belongs. Note: Anyone with the Browse Project permission can view an issue's time tracking information._

Ref: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA060/Logging+Work+on+an+Issue

Observed Behaviour: If a user that does not have the "Work On Issues" permission (confirmed with Permission Helper) creates an issue, they are able to see the Time Tracking field, in other words they are able to enter an Original Estimate.

Expected Behaviour: JIRA should match what the documentation describes.  If the "Work On Issues" permission is not associated with a particular person, that person should not be able to enter an Original Estimate when creating an issue.
fields.summary: Work On Issues permission is not obeyed by Time Tracking field in Create Issue screen
Display parent task fields on subtask views
Option to branch / tag when managing versions
Would like to be able to create columns to use horizontal space on issue pages

fields.description:
On smaller displays, the sub-tasks menu overlaps "Time Tracking" when viewed in the new "Detailed View" of issue filtering. Even when minimizing the Filter menu, there is still significant overlap. The screen resolution I'm using is 1280 x 800 and default browser zoom. Can reproduce the result in both Chrome and IE10. Other elements on the page, like the Details section, are much more responsive to width changes.

Please let me know if I can provide any more information.

Thanks in advance!
fields.summary: Sub-task display overlaps time tracking on smaller displays (like laptops)
Dashboard fails to load in Firefox 24 (aurora)

fields.description:
The JQL Query length in the Issue Navigator has been limited in Jira 6.0.2 to about 2000 characters - roughly as long as can be accommodated when the Navigator's context is specified using the GET method - with the query encoded in the url. Indeed, executing the search specified in:

{code} issuekey in (DS-1984, DS-1985) {code}

... results in the page invoked through {{https://.../jira/issues/?filter=-2&jql=issuekey%20in%20(DS-1984%2C%20DS-1985)}}

A common use case where this is limiting is when specifying an itemized set of issues using the {{issuekey in ()}} construct, very convenient when the list of issues is coming from an external source (external tool, spreadsheet, etc.). With four character project keys and four digit numbers, this amounts to about 200 issues, which is not unreasonable.

The syntax worked for much longer strings in Jira 5.0.1, presumably when the context of the query was passed using the POST method (we never had the need to closely inspect how it worked). 

Currently, it is impossible to launch the Issue Navigator using the {{issuekey in ()}} syntax with more than 200 issue keys even from an external tool and using the POST method, as the Issue Navigator's UI  just shuts it off. This is rendering a number of established tools and processes inoperable.

Alternative ways of describing the selection, e.g. using filters, is not a viable option because the set of issues is generally composed by methods external to Jira and thus the only straightforward way is to use an explicit listing.
fields.summary: JQL Query string length limited in Jira 6.0.2
Text Gadget doesn't appear on login screen (even if it's added to the system dashboard)
Attach screenshot feature should store as png instead of jpg
Roll back the change that prevents users from being deleted if they have made comments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33790].
  {panel}

Hey,
I migrated JIRA to test env from 4.3 to 5.2, it is implemented on IIS 7 server,
using TOMCAT 5.0.29.
The login.jsp page is started and recognizing currnet user with windows authentication automatically, but there is a windows security window (requesting for username&password) that pop-ups, that can be cancelled without any promts. Then JIRA starts normally. That problem wasnt existed on previous version. I have checked many things, and tried to isolate the problem, and I think it is related to web.xml file or web.config file.
Can you please help me?
Thank you!
fields.summary: Windows security window pop-ups when entering JIRA 5.2 defined with SSO
Allow OnDemand users to create and configure mail accounts using their instances domain name.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33788].
  {panel}

Tested in JIRA 5.2.7
Affected system fields: Assignee and Reporter

When using the usernames to search under the 'Suggested Users' list, user will not able to find users by typing the username, but if they type in the Full Name, the user appears. 

As an example, I have a user with:
** Username: checking
** Full Name: name
* We can see that the user is under the suggested users list:
!1.PNG|thumbnail!
* When I type 'name' the user appears. Shown as:
!2.PNG|thumbnail!
* When I type 'checking' it returns no match. (Because this user is under the suggested list)
!3.PNG|thumbnail!

However, this seems to be improved inside JIRA 6.0.x. In JIRA 6, you can search the user by both username or Full Name, even the user is under the suggested list.
fields.summary: Basic search in Issue Navigator can't find by username to autocomplete in Assginee and Reporter field

fields.description: In case that there is a proxy server set on Confluence, when subscripting the Confluence gadget on JIRA, it throws a connection timeout error. It seems that the http client using in the gadget feed spec provider is not taking in account any proxy setting from the JVM parameters.
fields.summary: The http client used for the gadget feed subscription do not respect the JVM proxy setting

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33783].
  {panel}

h5. Summary
Currently, JIRA BTF cannot link to a Confluence page using [Confluence Page Title]. As this feature is available for OnDemand, we shall have this feature in BTF as well. 

We can only link to a Confluence page using [Issue Linking|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Linking+Issues#LinkingIssues-CreatingalinktoaConfluencepage]

In both OnDemand and BTF, the settings are as below:
* Application link is configured
* Project link to Confluence Space is configured

h5. Screencast
For OnDemand: http://screencast.com/t/sL9S8Cmmk
For BTF: http://screencast.com/t/7fWdfgfffz9G

h5. Workaround
User can link to a Confluence page using this notation
{code}
[Confluence Page|<link to Confluence page>]
{code}
fields.summary: Link to a Confluence Page using notation
